 43          Construct Kalman filter. 
 44   
 45          @param stateTransitionMatrix: State transition matrix. 
 46          @param controlMatrix: Control input matrix. 
 47          @param measurementMatrix: Measurement observation matrix. 
 48          @param state: Initial state estimate. 
 49          @param stateCovariance: Initial state covariance matrix.

 51          @param measurementCovariance: Measurement noise covariance matrix.

 54          self.stateTransitionMatrix = stateTransitionMatrix

 56          self.measurementMatrix = measurementMatrix

 65 -    def state(self, state): 

 66          assert 0 < np.ndim(state) <= 2, "state must be a vector" 
 67          x = state.reshape(-1,1) 
 68          self._states = x.shape[0] 
 69          self._x = np.asmatrix(x) 
 70          self._I = np.eye(self._states)

139 -    def predict(self, control=None): 

140          """ 
141          Predict the system state at the next timestep, updating the estimate. 
142   
143          @param control: Mx1 L{np.ndarray} of control inputs, or None if there 
144              are no control inputs to the system. 
145          """ 
146          A,B,P,Q,x = self._A, self._B, self._P, self._Q, self._x 
147   
148          assert (control is None) == (B is None), \ 
149              "Control input must be given if and only if control matrix is set." 
150   
151          if B is None: 
152              B = 0 
153              u = 0 
154          else: 
155              u = np.asanyarray(control).reshape(-1,1) 
156   
157          self._x = A*x + B*u 
158          self._P = A*P*A.T + Q 

159   

160 -    def innovation(self, measurement): 

161          """ 
162          Calculate the filter innovation and covariance for a given measurement. 
163   
164          @param measurement: Nx1 L{np.ndarray} of measurement inputs. 
165   
166          @return: Nx1 innovation vector, NxN covariance matrix of the 
167              innovation, and MxN cross covariance from states to measurements. 
168          """ 
169          C,P,R,x = self._C, self._P, self._R, self._x 
170          y = np.asanyarray(measurement).reshape(-1,1) 
171   
172          innovation = y - C*x 
173          crossCovariance = P*C.T 
174          innovationCovariance = C*crossCovariance + R 
175   
176          return innovation, innovationCovariance, crossCovariance 

177   

178 -    def correct(self, measurement): 

179          """ 
180          Correct the filter state given a new measurement. 
181   
182          @param measurement: Nx1 L{np.ndarray} of measurement inputs. 
183          """ 
184          y = np.asanyarray(measurement).reshape(-1,1) 
185          innovation, innovationCovariance, crossCovariance = \ 
186                  self.innovation(y) 
187   
188          self._K = crossCovariance * inv(innovationCovariance) 
189          self._x = self._x + self._K*innovation 
190          self._P = (self._I - self._K*self._C) * self._P 

191   

192 -    def update(self, measurement, control=None): 

193          """ 
194          Run filter update given measurement and control inputs. 
195   
196          @param measurement: Nx1 L{np.ndarray} of measurement inputs. 
197          @param control: Mx1 L{np.ndarray} of control inputs, or None if there 
198              are no control inputs to the system. 
199   
200          """ 
201          self.predict(control) 
202          self.correct(measurement) 

203   

204 -    def normalisedInnovation(self, measurement): 

205          """ 
206          Obtain the normalised innovation for a given measurement. 
207   
208          @param measurement: Nx1 L{np.ndarray} of measurement inputs. 
209          """ 
210          innovation, innovationCovariance, crossCovariance = \ 
211                  self.innovation(measurement) 
212          normalisedInnovation = np.empty_like(innovation) 
213          for j,i in enumerate(innovation): 
214              normalisedInnovation[j] = i / np.sqrt(innovationCovariance[j,j]) 
215   
216          return normalisedInnovation

218 -class UnscentedKalmanFilter(KalmanFilter): 

219      """ 
220      Implementation of the unscented Kalman filter algorithm for additive noise. 
221   
222      Implementation equations are taken from Wan and Van Der Merwe, "The 
223      Unscented Kalman Filter", table 7.3.2. 
224   
225      @ivar stateUpdateFunction: Non-linear function to propagate state into the 
226          next timestep. The function is called with two arguments, the current 
227          Nx1 state vector and the current Mx1 control input vector. It should 
228          return a new Nx1 state vector. N and M are the numbers of states and 
229          control inputs. 
230      @ivar measurementFunction: Non-linear function relating state variables 
231          to expected measurements. The function is called with the current Nx1 
232          state vector as an argument, and should return an Mx1 measurement 
233          vector. N and M are the numbers of states and measurement outputs. 
234      @ivar state: Current state estimate. 
235      @ivar stateCovariance: State covariance matrix. 
236      @ivar processCovariance: Process noise covariance matrix. 
237      @ivar measurementCovariance: Measurement noise covariance matrix. 
238      """ 
239   

240 -    def __init__(self, stateUpdateFunction, measurementFunction, state, 
241              stateCovariance, processCovariance, measurementCovariance): 

242          """ 
243          Construct unscented Kalman filter. 
244   
245          @param stateUpdateFunction: Non-linear function to propagate state into 
246              the next timestep. The function is called with two arguments, the 
247              current Nx1 state vector and the current Mx1 control input vector. 
248              It should return a new Nx1 state vector. N and M are the numbers of 
249              states and control inputs. 
250          @param measurementFunction: Non-linear function relating state 
251              variables to expected measurements. The function is called with the 
252              current Nx1 state vector as an argument, and should return an Mx1 
253              measurement vector. N and M are the numbers of states and measurement 
254              outputs. 
255          @param state: Initial state estimate. 
256          @param stateCovariance: Initial state covariance matrix. 
257          @param processCovariance: Process noise covariance matrix. 
258          @param measurementCovariance: Measurement noise covariance matrix. 
259          """ 
260   
261          self.stateUpdateFunction = stateUpdateFunction 
262          self.measurementFunction = measurementFunction 
263   
264          self.state = state 
265          self.stateCovariance = stateCovariance 
266          self.processCovariance = processCovariance 
267          self.measurementCovariance = measurementCovariance

271          return self._stateUpdateUT._function

274 -    def stateUpdateFunction(self, function):

279          return self._measurementUT._function

285 -    def predict(self, control=None): 

286          state, stateCovariance = self._stateUpdateUT(self._x, self._P, *[control]) 
287          self._x = state 
288          self._P = stateCovariance + self._Q 
289          assert self._x.shape == (self._states,1) 
290          assert np.all(np.isfinite(self._x)) 
291          assert self._P.shape == (self._states, self._states) 
292          assert np.all(np.isfinite(self._P)) 

293   

294 -    def innovation(self, measurement): 

295          measurement = np.asanyarray(measurement).reshape(-1,1) 
296          predictedMeasurement, predictionCovariance, \ 
297              stateSigmas, measurementSigmas, weights = \ 
298                  self._measurementUT(self._x, self._P, returnSigmas=True) 
299          x,y = self._x, predictedMeasurement 
300          sigmaPoints = izip(weights, stateSigmas, measurementSigmas) 
301          innovation = measurement - predictedMeasurement 
302          innovationCovariance = self._R + predictionCovariance 
303          crossCovariance = np.sum((w*(X-x)*(Y-y).T for (w,X,Y) in sigmaPoints), axis=0) 
304          return innovation, innovationCovariance, crossCovariance 

305   

306 -    def correct(self, measurement): 

307          measurement = np.asanyarray(measurement).reshape(-1,1) 
308          innovation, innovationCovariance, crossCovariance = \ 
309                  self.innovation(measurement) 
310          self._K = np.dot(crossCovariance, inv(innovationCovariance)) 
311          self._x = self._x + self._K * innovation 
312          assert self._x.shape == (self._states,1) 
313          assert np.all(np.isfinite(self._x)) 
314          self._P = self._P - self._K * innovationCovariance * self._K.T 
315          assert self._P.shape == (self._states, self._states) 
316          assert np.all(np.isfinite(self._P))
